content.text:
# List of wars involving Mali

This is a list of wars involving the Republic of Mali.

|-

! style="background:#009933" rowspan="1" width=140px| Combatant 1
! style="background:#009933" rowspan="1" width=140px| Combatant 2

|style="background:#efefef"| Ganda Koy
|style="background:#efefef"| Arab Islamic Front of Azawad (FIAA)Popular Movement for the Liberation of Azawad (MPLA)United Movements and Fronts of Azawad (MFUA)Front for the Liberation of Aïr and Azaouak (FLAA)Front for the Liberation of Tamoust (FLT)CRA & ORA coalitions (1994–1995)

|style="background:#efefef"|
|style="background:#efefef"| ADCATMNC (2008 split)Niger Movement for JusticeFront of Forces for Rectification (2008 split)Niger Patriotic Front (2009 split)
|style="background:#efefef"| Stalemate
* Peace deals brokered by Mali in August 2008 and February 2009
* Ceasefire and amnesty declared in Niger in May 2009
* Integration of some rebels into the military
|-

----
Nigerien anti-coup movement:
* Patriotic Front for Justice
* Free Armed Forces
Coordination of Azawad Movements (2014-2021, 2023-2024)
*  MNLA (2012-2024)
*  HCUA (2013-2024)
*  MAA (2012-2024)
GATIA (al-Mahmoud faction) (2023–2024)
Patriotic Liberation Front (2023-2024)}}
|style="background:#efefef"| Ongoing
* Mali War: Tuareg rebels and allied Islamists overrun Northern Mali in 2012 until pushed back by a French intervention
* Islamist insurgency in Burkina Faso: Mali War spills over into Burkina Faso by 2015 as Islamists capture about 40% of Burkinabé territory
* Islamist insurgency in Niger
* Boko Haram insurgency arises and extends in Chad, Niger, and Cameroon
* French and American intervention on behalf of governments
* Al-Qaeda–Islamic State conflict and the JNIM-ISGS war
* Jihadist insurgency in Northern Benin
* Rise of the coup belt
|-
|style="background:#efefef"| Tuareg Rebellion of 2012(2012)
|style="background:#efefef"|  FLNA Ganda Iso
|style="background:#efefef"|
* MNLA
Ansar Dine MOJWA
|style="background:#efefef"| Defeat
* Malian President Amadou Toumani Touré is outed by a coup d'état
* MNLA and Ansar Dine take control of all Northern Mali territory
* Independent state of Azawad declared by the MNLA and initially supported by Ansar Dine
* Conflict between the MNLA and Ansar Dine (the latter receiving support from AQIM and MOJWA).
|-
|style="background:#efefef"| Mali War(2012–present)
|style="background:#efefef"|
|style="background:#efefef"|  Ansar Dine AQIM
|style="background:#efefef"| Ongoing
* Partial defeat of the Islamists and ceasefire with the MNLA
|}
